documentation.text:
@title TokenPaymentSplitter
 @dev This contract is a modified version of OpenZeppelin's PaymentSplitter contract. This contract allows to split Token payments
 among a group of accounts. The sender does not need to be aware that the Token will be split in this way, since it is handled
 transparently by the contract.
 The split can be in equal parts or in any other arbitrary proportion. The way this is specified is by assigning each
 account to a number of shares.
 The actual transfer is triggered as a separate function.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "PaymentSplitter: payees and shares length mismatch"

arguments.value: PaymentSplitter: payees and shares length mismatch

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "PaymentSplitter: payees and shares length mismatch"

documentation.text:
@dev Creates an instance of `TokenPaymentSplitter` where each account in `payees` is assigned the number of shares at
 the matching position in the `shares` array.
 All addresses in `payees` must be non-zero. Both arrays must have the same non-zero length, and there must be no
 duplicates in `payees`.
@dev Getter for the total shares held by payees.
@dev Getter for the amount of shares held by an account.
@dev Getter for the address of the payee number `index`.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "PaymentSplitter: account is the zero address"

arguments.value: PaymentSplitter: account is the zero address

devdoc.details: This contract is a modified version of OpenZeppelin's PaymentSplitter contract. This contract allows to split Token payments among a group of accounts. The sender does not need to be aware that the Token will be split in this way, since it is handled transparently by the contract. The split can be in equal parts or in any other arbitrary proportion. The way this is specified is by assigning each account to a number of shares. The actual transfer is triggered as a separate function.

constructor.details: Creates an instance of `TokenPaymentSplitter` where each account in `payees` is assigned the number of shares at the matching position in the `shares` array. All addresses in `payees` must be non-zero. Both arrays must have the same non-zero length, and there must be no duplicates in `payees`.

payee(uint256).details: Getter for the address of the payee number `index`.

shares(address).details: Getter for the amount of shares held by an account.

totalShares().details: Getter for the total shares held by payees.
